snippet: Scores of men, women and children were killed outside Damascus in an attack marked by the telltale signs of chemical weapons.
abstract: Scores of Syrian men, women and children are killed outside Damascus in attack marked by telltale signs of chemical weapons; images of death and chaos coming out of Syria show what may be single deadliest attack in more than two years of civil war; even with videos, witness accounts and testimonies by emergency medics, it is still impossible to say for certain how many people were killed and what exactly killed them.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow; C.J. Chivers from the United States; Peter Baker and Thom Shanker from Washington; Alan Cowell from London; Alissa J. Rubin from Paris; Mac Bishop from New York; and Karam Shoumali from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Scores of men, women and children were killed outside Damascus in an attack marked by the telltale signs of chemical weapons.

headline.main: Images of Death in Syria, but No Proof of Chemical Attack
headline.print_headline: Scores Killed in Syria, With Signs of Chemical War

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
